identifier.description: identifier is a per tnf.Test unique identifier.  For more information, consult https://github.com/test-network-function/test-network-function/blob/main/DEVELOPING.md#test-identifiers.

url.description: url stores the unique identifier for a test.

version.description: version stores the semantic version of the test.

step.description: step is an instruction for a single REEL pass.  To process a step, first send the execute string to the target subprocess (if supplied).  Block until the subprocess output to stdout matches one of the regular expressions in expect (if any supplied).

execute.description: execute is a Unix command to execute using the underlying subprocess.

expect.description: expect is an array of expected text regular expressions.  Order is important, as the first matched expectation is used, and further expectations are disregarded.

timeout.description: timeout is the timeout for the Step.  A positive timeout prevents blocking forever.  Provide the timeout in nanoseconds.

isIntCondition.description: isIntCondition is an implementation of the condition.Condition interface which evaluates whether a match string is an integer.

type.description: type stores the sentinel which represents the type of Condition implemented.

intComparisonCondition.description: intComparisonCondition is an implementation of the condition.Condition interface which converts a match string to an integer, then checks the integer comparison against input.

type.description: type stores the sentinel which represents the type of Condition implemented.

input.description: input is the right operand of the integer comparison.  For example, int(match[groupIdx]) == input.

comparison.description: comparison is the sentinel string used to identify the integer comparison type.  The following comparisons are supported: "==", "<", "<=", ">", ">=", "!=".

stringEqualsCondition.description: stringEqualsCondition is an implementation of the condition.Condition interface which evaluates string equality of a match against expected.

type.description: type stores the sentinel which represents the type of Condition implemented.

expected.description: expected is the expected string value.

logic.description: logic represents boolean logic.  Given a set of conditions, it is useful to make assertions over the set using some sort of boolean logic ("and" and "or", for example).

type.description: type stores the sentinel which represents the type of BooleanLogic implemented.

assertion.description: assertion provides the ability to assert a Condition for the string extracted from GroupIdx of Match.

groupIdx.description: groupIdx is the index in the match string used in the Assertion.

condition.description: condition is the condition.Condition asserted in this Assertion.

composedAssertion.description: composedAssertions is a means of making many assertion.Assertion claims about the match.

assertions.description: assertions provides the ability to compose BooleanLogic claims across any number of Assertion instances.

logic.definition: logic is the BooleanLogic implementation to that is asserted over Assertions.

resultContext.description: resultContexts provides the ability to make assertion.Assertions based on the given pattern matched.

pattern.description: pattern is the pattern causing a match in reel.Handler ReelMatch.

composedAssertions.description: composedAssertions is a means of making many assertion.Assertion claims about the match.

defaultResult.description: defaultResult is the result of the test.  This is only used if ComposedAssertions is not provided.

nextStep.description: nextStep is an optional next step to take after an initial ReelMatch.

nextResultContexts.description: nextResultContexts is an optional array which provides the ability to make assertion.Assertions based on the next pattern match.

pattern.description: pattern is the pattern causing a match in reel.Handler ReelMatch.

before.description: before contains all output preceding match.

description: generic-test is a construct for defining an arbitrary simple test with prescriptive confines.  Essentially, the definition of the state machine for a Generic reel.Handler is restricted in this facade implementation, since most common use cases do not require too much heavy lifting.

identifier.description: identifier is a per tnf.Test unique identifier.  For more information, consult https://github.com/test-network-function/test-network-function/blob/main/DEVELOPING.md#test-identifiers.

arguments.description: arguments is the Unix command array.

description.description: description is a textual description of the overall functionality that is tested.

failureReason.description: failureReason optionally stores extra information pertaining to why the test failed.

matches.description: matches contains an in order array of matches.

items.description: match stores information about the matched regular expression, if one exists.

reelFirstStep.description: reelFirstStep is the first step returned by reel.ReelFirst().

resultContexts.description: resultContexts provides the ability to make assertion.Assertions based on the given pattern matched.

reelTimeoutStep.description: reelTimeoutStep is the reel.Step to take upon timeout.

testResult.description: testResult is the result of running the tnf.Test.  0 indicates ERROR, 1 indicates SUCCESS, 2 indicates FAILURE.

testTimeout.description: testTimeout prevents the Test from running forever.  Provide the testTimeout in nanoseconds.
